summary: In this context, 1,1,2-trichloroethene is categorized as a chlorinated aliphatic hydrocarbon (CAH), which is a subset of volatile organic compounds (VOCs). The text discusses various types of VOCs, including chlorinated hydrocarbons, and highlights the regulatory definitions that encompass these compounds. Thus, 1,1,2-trichloroethene is directly related to the broader category of chlorinated hydrocarbons, indicating its significance in environmental and health discussions regarding VOCs.
